text: Wang Shuaiting (; born October 1955) is a former Chinese business executive. He worked in China Resources Power, China Resources and Hong Kong CTS Group () during his career. On May 16, 2014, Wang Shuaiting was placed under investigation by the Communist Party's anti-corruption agency.香港中旅(集团)有限公司总经理王帅廷涉嫌严重违纪违法接受组织调查 ==Career== Wang Shuaiting was born in Feng County, Jiangsu. He graduated from Xuzhou Normal University in 1982, and started to work in September 1982. Wang was the General Manager of Xuzhou China Resources Power Co., Ltd in 1994, and became the general manager of China Resources Power in 2001. In 2002, he joined the board of directors of China Resources, and become the vice-chairman of China Resources in 2009. In April 2011, Wang Shuaiting became the general manager and vice chairman of Hong Kong CTS Group.中国领导干部资料库：王帅廷 On May 16, 2014, Wang Shuaiting was placed under investigation by the Party's internal disciplinary body for "serious violations of laws and regulations". Wang Shuaiting was expelled from the Communist Party on September 11, 2015. On February 28, 2017, Wang was sentenced to 16 years in prison for taking bribes worth 40.08 million yuan (~$5.83 million), plundering the public treasury worth 7.08 million yuan (~$1.03 million) in Shenzhen People's Intermediate Court. ==References== Category:1955 births Category:Living people Category:People from Feng County, Jiangsu Category:China Resources people Category:Businesspeople from Jiangsu Category:Expelled members of the Chinese Communist Party Category:Chinese white-collar criminals
title: Wang Shuaiting
